contents.contents: Walk down the rue Saint Jean.
Provins used to be the third most important French city (after Paris and Rouen). It was well-known for its fairs and markets. Today, 58 of its monuments are listed as “historical”.

choices: Best preserved medieval town in France
Because it is a former Roman town
Because it is an ancient market town

explanations.contents: It is a former fair town, protected from war damage. It is also the best preserved medieval town in France. Roses are its best-selling item.
